timeline.bodyText:
Could you add a comment explaining how does changing MlNativeAutodetectIntegTestCase to ESRestTestCase solve the issue this PR is supposed to solve?
If I were to write a new IT test, how would I know which base class should I use?
timeline.author: przemekwitek

replies.bodyText:
@przemekwitek there are cleanups and cluster state requirements in MlNativeAutodetectIntegTestCase which are causing problems. Something with how ingest pipeline _simulate works is disallowing cleanups to occur (has nothing to do with our code). I attempted to troubleshoot, but it started to turn into wasted time.
So, instead, I moved to REST cases instead.
replies.author: benwtrent

replies.bodyText: Could you add at least one sentence in class-level comment? Just in an unlikely case someone does a rewrite of this test to MlNativeAutodetectIntegTestCase in a year from now not remembering there was an issue.
replies.author: przemekwitek

timeline.bodyText:
Do you plan to use this method in other places?
If not, you can either inline it into cleanUpData or make it private.
timeline.author: przemekwitek

replies.bodyText:
I think there should be a wider rethink of the cleanup methods.
MlNativeAutodetectIntegTestCase extends MlNativeIntegTestCase, and MlNativeIntegTestCase already has an @After method that calls the abstract method cleanUpResources() then waits for pending tasks.
Since this clearMlState() method also waits for pending tasks that means we're waiting twice, which will slow down the cleanup.  If possible I would prefer that we only wait for pending tasks once, at the very end of all cleanup operations.
@benwtrent please can you try to integrate your cleanup into the MlNativeIntegTestCase framework, by overriding cleanUpResources().  And if that doesn't work for some reason and multiple cleanup phases are required please add some comments explaining what the full sequence is and why a simpler sequence doesn't work.  (For example, I can imagine there might be something annoying like the ML annotations index being created part way through the cleanup, but if you found that problem and worked around it it would be good to document that this can happen so that the next maintainer can take it into account.)
replies.author: droberts195

replies.bodyText:
@droberts195 I don't understand

Since this clearMlState() method also waits for pending tasks that means we're waiting twice, which will slow down the cleanup.

This test class is now inheriting from ESRestTestCase which does not wait for tasks to finish.
This clean up code is the same we use for other ESRestTestCase classes.
MlNativeIntegTestCase already does something similar (see: 
  
    
      elasticsearch/x-pack/plugin/ml/qa/native-multi-node-tests/src/test/java/org/elasticsearch/xpack/ml/integration/MlNativeIntegTestCase.java
    
    
         Line 128
      in
      d2aee62
    
    
    
    

        
          
           cleanUpResources(); 
        
    
  

)
As for the issues I originally had that prompted this change to ESRestTestCase, the issue has nothing to do with any code paths that the ML team has written. It even occurred with the set processor. So, adjusting our cleanup process would do nothing.
@przemekwitek

Do you plan to use this method in other places?

I could make it private
replies.author: benwtrent

replies.bodyText: Sorry, I must have been colour blind when reading the diff.
replies.author: droberts195

timeline.bodyText: Before the isAcknowledged bit was being checked. Would it be possible to add an equivalent check in the new setting?
timeline.author: przemekwitek

replies.bodyText: I could, but it is not really required as anything other than a 200 will throw.
replies.author: benwtrent

timeline.bodyText: Is this a standard practice in REST tests to grep for substrings rather than parsing the response into JSON?
timeline.author: przemekwitek

replies.bodyText: Yes, it is. It checks what I want without having to parse an object.
replies.author: benwtrent

timeline.message: Merge branch 'feature/ml-inference-fix-issue-51201' of github.com:benwtrent/elasticsearch into feature/ml-inference-fix-issue-51201
Adding comment as to why it is a rest test case
